quote: I was that weird kid that checked out all of the non-fiction paranormal studies books from the library. I've always been fascinated by the supernatural, particularly movies and TV shows that manage to blend humor with the horror - 'Supernatural', 'Buffy', 'Angel.'
author: Molly Harper

quote: People have a hunger to experience the spectacular, but the Lord is supernatural.
author: Sherry K. White

quote: Paranormal events are just edges of the infinite we “happen” to encounter.
author: Doug Dillon

quote: Surprisingly, the Christian faith today is perceived as disconnected from the supernatural world – a dimension that the vast majority of outsiders believe can be accessed and influenced.
author: David Kinnaman,  Unchristian: What a New Generation Really Thinks about Christianity...and Why It Matters

quote: Writers are the exorcists of their own demons.
author: Mario Vargas Llosa

quote: A mind possessed by unmade books.
author: Michael Faudet

quote: God is A.W.E.S.O.M.E! HE is Always Working Extraordinary Supernatural On-time Miracles Everyday
author: Sommer Ellison

quote: Crazy Horse dreamed and went into the world where there is nothing but the spirits of all things. That is the real world that is behind this one, and everything we see here is something like a shadow from that one.
author: Black Elk,  Black Elk Speaks: Being the Life Story of a Holy Man of the Oglala Sioux

quote: I suppose the secret of his success is in his tremendous idleness which almost approaches the supernatural.
author: Lawrence Durrell,  Justine

quote: Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living, it's a way of looking at life through the wrong end of a telescope.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: We need not take refuge in supernatural gods to explain our saints and sages and heroes and statesmen, as if to explain our disbelief that mere unaided human beings could be that good or wise.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: Owning our story can be hard but not nearly as difficult as spending our lives running from it. Embracing our vulnerabilities is risky but not nearly as dangerous as giving up on love and belonging and joy—the experiences that make us the most vulnerable. Only when we are brave enough to explore the darkness will we discover the infinite power of our light.
author: Brené Brown

quote: Religion. A daughter of Hope and Fear, explaining to Ignorance the nature of the Unknowable.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: I feel that we should stop wasting our time trying to please the supernatural and concentrate on improving the welfare of human beings. I think that, uh, we should use our energy and our initiative to solve our problems, and stop relying on prayer and wishful thinking. If we have faith in ourselves, we won't have to have faith in gods.
author: Ruth Hurmence Green

quote: Enigmatic Real Estate I choose to live on the edge of mysterywith its inscrutable view of complexityhedged by perplexity.Also, there's a Walmart nearby.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: I am a great admirer of mystery and magic. Look at this life - all mystery and magic.
author: Harry Houdini

quote: Manifestation is a process by which we transform seemingly unrealizable imaginations to reality.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Vampires. They wrote the book on possessive.
author: Charlaine Harris,  Dead to the World

quote: Religion, n. A daughter of Hope and Fear, explaining to Ignorance the nature of the Unknowable.
author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary

quote: Stephenie Meyer: Her vampires are sparkly, which I think we can all agree is wrong.
author: Christopher Moore

quote: Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living, it's a way of looking at life through the wrong end of a telescope, and that enables you to laugh at life's realities.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky.
author: Alan Moore

quote: I love the spirit of Halloween and the energy that comes with it.
author: Katharine McPhee

quote: There was a time when people accepted magical experiences as natural. There were no priests then, and no one went chasing after the secrets of the occult.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living, It's a way of looking at life through the wrong end of a telescope. Which is what I do, And that enables you to laugh at life's realities.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: A story was a form of telepathy. By means of inking symbols onto a page, she was able to send thoughts and feelings from her mind to her reader's. It was a magical process, so commonplace that no one stopped to wonder at it.
author: Ian McEwan,  Atonement

quote: Witchcraft to the ignorant, .... Simple science to the learned.
author: Leigh Brackett

quote: Paranormalists, however, insist that our minds are transmitters that, with special effort, can focus like lasers to communicate across great distances, and even make things happen. That may seem far-fetched, but it's also a definition of prayer.
author: Alan Weisman,  The World Without Us

quote: Believe in the wonderment of life, the magic of love, and the reality of death.
author: Carroll Bryant

quote: Life is but a momentary glimpse of the wonder of this astonishing universe, and it is sad to see so many dreaming it away on spiritual fantasy.
author: Andy Mulcahy

quote: MagicSandra’s seen a leprechaun,Eddie touched a troll,Laurie danced with witches once,Charlie found some goblins gold.Donald heard a mermaid sing,Susy spied an elf,But all the magic I have knownI've had to make myself.
author: Shel Silverstein,  Where the Sidewalk Ends: The Poems and Drawings of Shel Silverstein

quote: I was raised among books, making invisible friends in pages that seemed cast from dust and whose smell I carry on my hands to this day.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind

quote: Whoever possessed knowledge not only had power over the changeable passions of people, but also power over their thinking, over their minds, hearts and souls.
author: Peter Prange,  The Philosopher's Kiss: A Novel

quote: This isn't a book. This isn't a paranormal fantasy or whatever the hell it is you read. There is no set plot or clear idea of where any of this is going. The enemies aren't obvious. There are no guaranteed happy endings.
author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,  Opal

quote: It's a dark, cool, quiet place. A basement in your soul. And that place can sometimes be dangerous to the human mind. I can open the door and enter that darkness, but I have to be very careful. I can find my story there. Then I bring that thing to the surface, into the real world.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: Christian spirituality was not a children's story. It wasn't cute or neat. It was mystical and odd and clean, and it was reaching into dirty. There was wonder in it and enchantment.
author: Donald Miller,  Blue Like Jazz: Nonreligious Thoughts on Christian Spirituality

quote: Life is so magical, mysterious, magnificent, and peaceful.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Life is always going to be stranger than fiction, because fiction has to be convincing, and life doesn't.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Vampires. Honestly, they're like children sometimes.
author: Richelle Mead,  Succubus Blues

quote: Voodoo GirlHer skin is white cloth,and she's all sewn apartand she has many colored pinssticking out of her heart.She has many different zombieswho are deeply in her trance.She even has a zombiewho was originally from France.But she knows she has a curse on her,a curse she cannot win.For if someone getstoo close to her,the pins stick farther in.
author: Tim Burton

quote: Science Fiction: Any scientific acclaim that omits God.
author: Johnny Hart

quote: The love of learning, the sequestered nooks,And all the sweet serenity of books
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: This mindless tolerance, which places observable scientific facts, subject to proof, on the same level as unprovable supernatural fantasy, has played a major role in the resurgence of both anti-intellectualism and anti-rationalism.
author: Susan Jacoby,  The Age of American Unreason

quote: But I love Halloween, and I love that feeling: the cold air, the spooky dangers lurking around the corner.
author: Evan Peters

quote: Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures.
author: Jessamyn West

quote: Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: [Horror fiction] shows us that the control we believe we have is purely illusory, and that every moment we teeter on chaos and oblivion.
author: Clive Barker

quote: We write in ways that, we generally hope, reflect real life, or at least look familiar to humans. And in life, recurring themes are a recurring theme. We never quite conquer a pet vice or a relationship pattern or a communication habit. We're haunted by our particular demons.
author: Sara Zarr

quote: Some ghosts or felt presences may simply be the essence of another living person projected outward while sleeping.
author: Doug Dillon
